reason: Exhaustive search complete - unit existence in Q2 1941 unconfirmed

tier1.result: Found mobile division references, no XX Mobile Corps mentioned
No local copies in Resource Documents

gaps.reason: XX Mobile Corps not found in Tier 1 sources. Italian mobile/cavalry divisions (Ariete, Trieste, Trento) existed in Q2 1941, but no overarching XX Corps structure identified.
potential_next_steps: Check Comando Supremo website for Italian corps formations timeline
Review Niehorster Italian OOB for Q2 1941 North Africa order of battle
Search Regio Esercito online for corps activation dates
Check German liaison reports in Tessin volumes for Italian command structure
Review British Intelligence WO 208 assessments of Italian forces Q2 1941
Determine if unit was formed later (Q3 1941 or Q4 1941) and adjust extraction quarter

data_summary.extraction_quality_assessment: Unit existence unconfirmed in Q2 1941. Tier 1 sources do not document XX Mobile Corps headquarters. May be incorrect quarter, unit may not have been formed yet, or may have operated under different designation.

reason: Exhaustive search complete - unit did not exist in Q2 1941 (formed Q3 1941)

tier1.result: No XIII Corps found - shows Middle East Command under Gen. Wavell
No XIII Corps found - Western Desert Force still primary organization
No XIII Corps references for Q2 1941 period

tier2.result: Would need to check formation dates

gaps.status: UNIT DID NOT EXIST IN Q2 1941
gaps.reason: XIII Corps was formed in September 1941 (Q3 1941), not Q2 1941. In April-June 1941, British forces in North Africa were organized as Western Desert Force under Lt. Gen. Noel Beresford-Peirse. XIII Corps was established later when 8th Army was formed.
potential_next_steps: SKIP Q2 1941 extraction - unit did not exist
Extract Western Desert Force for Q2 1941 (the actual organization that existed)
Confirm formation date from official British Army histories
Check if project scope intends Q3 1941 or different unit for Q2 1941

data_summary.extraction_quality_assessment: Unit did not exist in Q2 1941. XIII Corps was formed September 1941 (Q3). British forces in North Africa Q2 1941 were organized as Western Desert Force under Lt. Gen. Beresford-Peirse following Operation Battleaxe.
